info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 4:20PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Berkshire, southeastern Rensselaer and southwestern Bennington Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 420 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Berlin, or 10 miles west of North Adams, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pittsfield, North Adams, Adams, Williamstown, Pownal, Cheshire, Grafton, Berlin, Hancock, Savoy, New Ashford, Averill Park, Berkshire, Brunswick, Sand Lake, Poestenkill, Lanesborough, Greylock, Soldiers Memorial Field and West Stephentown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
